author: Special Correspondent
text:
Coimbatore District Small Industries Association (Codissia) has won the best district-level industrial association award from Foundation for MSME Clusters. Association president E.K. Ponnuswamy received the “Responsible Indian BMO (Business Management Organisation)” at the district-level award on January 22.

Over 160 industrial associations had competed for the award from different parts of the country.

Mr. Ponnuswamy told The Hindu that the award was recognition to the services rendered by the association to its members. It was judged on nine parameters. It had been conducting awareness programmes and training sessions for entrepreneurship development. For entrepreneurs, it assisted them in marketing and supported them for future growth. “We are now recognised as the most responsible association.

The government wants to implement “zero defect zero effect” in the industries and industrial associations will play a significant role in this.”

Codissia was established in 1969 and has a membership of more than 2,000 small and medium-scale enterprises.
title: Codissia wins award
